pullRequest.title: Restart nucleus when proxy or role alias parameters change
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
The nucleus component should restart if any of the parameters under networkProxy change.
Why is this change necessary:
A nucleus restart is needed to ensure that new proxy values are used in all the right locations (env variables, mqtt client, etc).
How was this change tested:
Locally using the greengrass-cli to change nucleus parameters.
Any additional information or context required to review the change:
Checklist:

 Updated the README if applicable
 Updated or added new unit tests
 Updated or added new integration tests
 Updated or added new end-to-end tests

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

commit.message: Restart nucleus when proxy or role alias parameters change
Only restart for role alias when network proxy is used and use device config

nodes.bodyText: don't concat, just use the no proxy key.
This isn't correct because it could have a different name, you'd need to search for the component by type.
Shouldn't this return true if the currentDeviceConfiguration has proxy settings? (in the null "new" case)
Doesn't case matter? philcali != Philcali for things like auth, right?

commit.message: Add restart condition for removing proxy config and make stringHasChanged case sensitive
